transcripts.text: This is former Vice President Joe Biden, the presumptive Democratic presidential nominee.  And on Friday, May 1st, Biden appeared on MSNBC's Morning Joe.
Mr.  Vice President, thank you for coming on the show this morning.  We have a lot we want to ask you this morning.

Immediately, I am reminded how Biden keeps saying that President Trump needs to listen to the experts.  But in the meantime, Biden insists on coughing into his hand, even though health experts for decades have been warning Americans to stop doing that.
You know, you're supposed to cough into your elbow.  I don't know, sir.  I learned that actually covering your White House.
Cover your sneezes with your sleeve, not your hands.  Always sneeze or cough into the bend of your arm.
Actually, actually, that's true.  But fortunately, I'm alone in my home, but that's OK.  I have not been tested.

Anyway, Biden didn't come on Morning Joe to exclusively talk about the health crisis.  It was to address an allegation made against him by a former Senate aide.  And Morning Joe's Mika Brzezinski handled the questioning.

And I want to get right to the allegation made against you by Tara Reid.  So the former Senate aide accuses you of sexual assault.  Would you please go on the record with the American people?  Did you sexually assault Tara Reid?
I'm saying unequivocally, it never, never happened.
It never, never happened?  Oh, Joe.
Do you remember her?  Do you remember any types of complaints that she might have made?
I don't remember any type of complaint she may have made.  It was 27 years ago.

To be fair, Biden seems like he doesn't know where he is at any given time, so to expect him to remember anything from 27 years ago is kind of a stretch.  But this shows Mika's shortcomings as a journalist.  What she should have asked was, do you remember her?  And if so, what was your working relationship like?  Instead, Biden went straight into denying the allegations.  We have no idea if Reid was close to Biden, or if they even worked with each other on a one-on-one basis.  And that would be more helpful in drawing a more complete picture.
